snippet: The Birmingham Civil Rights Institute uses artifacts and renditions of scenes from the era to tell the story of a tense and tumultuous time in the city.
abstract: Birmingham Civil Rights Institute, a popular museum that attracts 150,000 visitors annually, uses artifacts and renditions of scenes from the civil rights era to tell the story of a racially tense and tumultuous time in Birmingham, Alabama.
lead_paragraph: The Birmingham Civil Rights Institute uses artifacts and renditions of scenes from the era to tell the story of a tense and tumultuous time in the city.
